definition: to give sb a meaningful look
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
color/CL:種|种[zhong3]/look/appearance/sex
color/dice

sentences.english: I'm pretty sure she winked at them, too.
sentences.chinese: 我還很肯定她還向她們使眼色。

sentences.english: He winks at all the girls who pass.
sentences.chinese: 他向所有經過的女孩使眼色。

sentences.english: Maybe I should wink to get her attention.
sentences.chinese: 也許我應該跟她使眼色引起她注意。

sentences.english: I'll tip you the wink when it's safe to come in.
sentences.chinese: 可以安全進來時，我會向你使眼色的。

sentences.english: If he winds at you, why don't you wink back if you like him?
sentences.chinese: 使眼色，你喜歡他爲什麼不回遞眼色呢？

sentences.english: He gave me a knowing wink.
sentences.chinese: 他對我使眼色，表示他懂。

sentences.english: Tom gave me a knowing wink.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆對我使眼色，表示他懂。

sentences.english: My sister turned to me, winking.
Lord Guan eyed Liu Bei, who sensed his brother's intent and rose to bid Zhou Yu farewell.
sentences.chinese: 關羽給劉備使眼色，劉備會意，起身告辭。

sentences.english: That girl is winking at me.
sentences.chinese: 那個女孩在對我使眼色。

definition: to give sb a meaningful look
signal made with one's eyes/meaningful glance
to pout/to stick out one's lips
to make eyes/to wink
to turn one's head/in no time/in the twinkling of an eye
to smile apologetically or obsequiously
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in

combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书[liu4 shu1] of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds/to comprehend without being told explicitly/to cotton on/knowing (smile, glance etc)
to glare at
to apologize
to take a furtive look at
to wave the hand (to say goodbye, or in a negative gesture)/crank handle
to answer/to respond/to converse
promptly/at once
to wink
to help to resolve a dispute/to smooth things over
